ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Continuation of L1 Japanese with more grammar and vocab. At the end of the semester, I feel comfortable engaging in more complex conversational language.
Strengthened understanding of Japanese grammar structures, vocabulary, as well as conversational skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Nishimura is an amazing professor and makes a very fun class! I've made good friends in Japanese and L2 helped solidify these relationships.

The strengths are all around: it is a rigorous and thorough introduction to Japanese. It must be the next best thing to learning Japanese outside of actually living in Japan. I think that the course could do more to teach and test on Japanese historical culture. I think a class visit to the Japanese art gallery in the YUAG wouldve been awesome

Strengths: Lots of homework that allowed me to gauge my skill level and gain the practice needed for language learning, quality slideshows and lesson material that feels well thought-out and organic, high-energy classroom environment

Weaknesses: Due to the fast-paced nature of the course material and having to meet 5 days a week, this course can be a little unaccommodating to those who find it hard to keep up. Nishimura-sensei herself was always empathetic and accommodating, but the nature of the course can feel too rigorous for some.
the amount of homework and practices in class really helped in retaining and learning more japanese at the same time

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! Although the language can be difficult at first, once you pick it up it is smooth to continue. I feel honored to have taken Japanese for two semesters with Nishimura, she is truly an amazing professor and very understanding.
I would, but only if you have an interest in Japanese language learning. I loved my experience, but I can see how people who aren't interested in the Japanese language may struggle.
Yes there were a lot of funny moments in the class, and I absolutely loved singing japanese songs together at the end. In the end, the students make the class fun so I would recommend this to anyone.
